body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Robert Rosenfield would respectfully state that he was fined one hundred dollars on a scire-facias at the April Term of City Court of Louisville. The facts of the case are these. Petitioner was a witness in a case of the Commonwealth against A. Kingsley charged with a misdemeanor. Said case was continued for five consecutive terms of Said court & your petitioner was in attendance every term, but when the case was called at the March Term your petitioner was not present, but arrived within five or ten minutes. Petitioner was recognized in open court & upon the slight fault mentioned above he was tried upon a scire facias & fined as above stated. For the truth of the state
ments made by petitioner your Excellency is refered to the statement of Phil Tompert Jr the clerk of said Court. Your petitioner is a poor man totally unable to pay such a sum of money, & as he intended no wrong he prays your Excellency to remit the fine
I was the only wits in this case, and the above statements are true
Phil Tomppert Jr C C C L

The petitioner Robert Rosenfield is a clever man & if the case of any one ever presented stronger grounds for remission we have never seen it. We heard the case & the statements in the petition are true as the attestation of the Clerk of the Court showes.

Direct to us
Very Respectfully
Baird & Price

Louisville City Ct
vs
Robt Rosenfield } Scire facia
$100
Remit except fees & costs
Apl 21st 1864
Tho E Bramlette
